DIF.Entry_Title: QSCAT/NCEP Blended Ocean Winds from Colorado Research Associates (version 5.0)

Data_Set_Citation.Dataset_Creator: UCAR/NCAR/CISL/DSS > Data Support Section, Computational and Information Systems Laboratory, National Center for Atmospheric Research, University Corporation for Atmospheric Research
Data_Set_Citation.Dataset_Title: QSCAT/NCEP Blended Ocean Winds from Colorado Research Associates (version 5.0)
Data_Set_Citation.Dataset_Publisher: UCAR/NCAR/CISL/DSS > Data Support Section, Computational and Information Systems Laboratory, National Center for Atmospheric Research, University Corporation for Atmospheric Research

Data_Center_Name.Long_Name: Research Data Archive, Computational and Information Systems Laboratory, National Center for Atmospheric Research, University Corporation for Atmospheric Research

DIF.Reference:
Milliff, R. F., J. Morzel, D. B. Chelton, and M. H. Freilich, 2004: Wind Stress Curl and Wind Stress Divergence Biases from Rain Effects on QSCAT Surface Wind Retrievals. J. Atmos. Ocean. Tech., 21, 1216-1231, URL: http://rda.ucar.edu/datasets/ds744.4/docs/JAOT.MILLIFF.2004.pdf.
Chin, T. M., R. F. Milliff, and W. G. Large, 1998: Basin-Scale High-Wavenumber Sea Surface Wind Fields from Multiresolution Analysis of Scatterometer Data. J. Atmos. Ocean. Technology, 15, 741-763, URL: http://rda.ucar.edu/datasets/ds744.4/docs/JAOT.CHIN.1998.pdf.

Summary.Abstract:
Ocean surface wind data are derived from spatial blending of high-resolution satellite data (SeaWinds instrument on the QuikSCAT satellite - QSCAT) and global weather center re-analyses (NCEP), resulting in high temporal and spatial resolution datasets (6-hourly, and 0.5 by 0.5 degree) of u- and v- wind vector components and windstress curl. The global coverage datasets begin in July 1999 and ends in July 2009.
Surface wind component and wind stress curl fields are available in three forms: 1) a product that is the blended wind field output, 2) fields consisting of the NCEP re-analyses spline interpolated to the 0.5 by 0.5 degree grid (i.e. no QSCAT data blended), and 3) a product that is output from an intermediate step in the blending process that consists of the superposition of QSCAT observations on NCEP before blending. This product is useful to identify the satellite data swaths in each composite of 12-hours of QSCAT observations.
CAUTION: This blended wind product was developed for general circulation scale analyses - see these cautionary notes [http://rda.ucar.edu/datasets/ds744.4/docs/Blended_Winds_Caution].
The blending methodology is summarized in this document [http://rda.ucar.edu/datasets/ds744.4/docs/Blended_Winds_Summary]. NOTE: The QSCAT satellite has permanent failed so this data time series has ended.

Related_URL.Description: The re-analyses winds are from the NCEP/NCAR Reanalysis project
